intro: Mesembryanthemum calandrum, commonly known as the carpet flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, often referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought through its thick, water-storing leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the early morning and close during the heat of the day. Mesembryanthemum calandrum is often used in ornamental gardening for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its low maintenance requirements.
